cause.description:
This cause aims to raise awareness and funds for organizations that support collaborative cultural and other movements, such as open source and free software movements, movements for social justice, etc. We are working towards societies that are open for anyone to express themselves without domination or hindrance by others. This cause is U.S.-specific and donates to the Free Software Foundation, as one way to reclaim the commons, but other organizations and projects exist with similar areas of focus that may interest you including:
The Creative Commons www.creativecommons.org
Open Source Development Labs www.osdl.org
various political parties and movements in the US and elsewhere, and the list goes on. A little bit of hunting on the net will go a long way in this regard.
1. Intellectual property laws need immediate reform to allow for greater public expression.
2. Citizens must be educated in the value of a public forum and/or commons when contrasted with private ownership of intellectual and material resources.
3. Collaborative efforts to practice and promote the arts and sciences must be actively encouraged by citizens and governments.
cause.mission: reclaim the ability of ordinary people to independently and cooperatively enhance their lives and societies through free expression through the arts and sciences
cause.name: Reclaim the Commons
